page.title: 04Colne Valley - Flora & Fauna
page.content: On the hilltops at Scapegoat Hill and Moorside Edge there is heather, and in places the cotton grass of the real peat moorland. In the narrow side valleys called Cloughs are fast running streams.Here, where it is more sheltered we find many more trees, particularly sycamore and oak. Here are found rabbit and hare, and in the lower valley, shrews and moles. Kingcups (marsh marigolds) grow near the streams. In the uncultivated fields grow dandelions and buttercups, celandines and daisies, while coltsfoots are common by the roadside. In the valley bottoms grow alder and lowland trees such as ash. A kingfisher may occasionally be seen by the river and voles can be found by the water.
